alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 11:57PM PDT until November 05 at 9:07AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. .Heavy rain in the North Cascades Friday has come to an end Friday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Nooksack River At North Cedarville. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 146.5 feet, the Nooksack River will cause shallow flooding of low pasture lands along the river downstream through Lynden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM PDT Friday the stage was 146.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest near 147.2 feet early Saturday morning. The river will recede back under flood stage later Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 146.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 800 AM PDT.
